result.execSummary:
The defendant Candle B Pridemore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
$243 court costs imposed in Ct. 2 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct. 1 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with Michael Wolf or his residence.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall not be present where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

supervisions.notes: $243 court costs imposed in Ct. 2 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct. 1 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.

Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  
Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence.

Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Concurrent with: Ct. 1.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
All conditions of probation imposed in Ct. 1 shall remain the same for Ct. 3.

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Resolution reached; Defendant has paid restitution in full.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Theft pursuant to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and to add Ct. 2, Misd. Theft 943.20(1)(a) and Ct. 3, Criminal Trespass 943.14 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on amended Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Cts. 1, 2 and 3.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court removes 2-09-16 Jury trial.

Hearing at 07-27-2015 09:45 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Alyssa Armbrust from the State Public Defenders Office.  Intern Samuel Tufford with Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for the State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests cash bond.  Argument on bond.  $2,500 signature bond set. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.
